instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Liquid spill on this board, i change <RESISTOR>R9731</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R9715</RESISTOR>, i have <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>=2,7V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_FUSED</SIGNAL>=8,35V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>=8,35V
i remove <CAPACITOR>C9796</CAPACITOR> look bad, is it necessary?
is it <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>, i don't see more damaged components

the board work well on external display.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> or the feedback trace to ball A5 on <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I remove <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> but C13 is missing <SIGNAL>TP_BKL_FAULT</SIGNAL> i don't see on schematic if this net is necessary.
Can you confirm if i put a new one, the missing pin is stopping the device from working?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Unused pin. Make sure to check ball A5 trace for continuity!

threads.title: [SOLVED]Backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Ok i change <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> now the light come back, i test it all the night and i come back tomorow, thanks
